result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott T. Ehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases heard today are 16CF123, 16CF253, 16CM125, 16CM474, 15CT179 and 17CF13.

10:57 a.m.   Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:

Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of & 3 of 16CM125, Count 2 & 3 of 16CF123, Count 1 & 2 of 16CF253, Count 1 of 16CM474, Count 1 of 15CT179 and Count 1 of 17CF13.  Counts DRI are 2 & 4 on 16CM125, 1 & 4 of 16CF123, 3 & 4 of 16CF253 and 2-5 on 17CF13. Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification.  No victim appears in Court today.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott T. Ehr in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Scott T. Ehr in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:16 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
These matters were set for a status conference.  The court received the report of the Dr. Gus. Gray with copies provided to counsel and the defendant.
Parties confirm.
Court reviewed the report and Dr. believes the defendant is able to proceed with legal proceedings.  
ADA makes statement to the court re: status of this case.  
Court has received a waiver of preliminary hearing.  Atty. Drengler makes statement to the court and asks that the commitment be discharged.  Court questions the defendant.  
Based on the report and the defendant's representations, the court will lift the commitment order and the proceedings be re-instituted.  

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Scott T. Ehr in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Scott T. Ehr in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-125, 15CT-179, 16CF-253 and 16CF-123.

10:05 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are scheduled for a competency hearing this morning.
Counsel received copy of the examiner's report.

Atty Drengler states that he reviewed the findings in the report with his client.

Court addresses Defendant.
Defendant is not responsive to the Court's question if he believes he is competent or not.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, is willing to accept the report's conclusion that Defendant is not competent but may become competent.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court, believes the report appropriately lays out the conclusions.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding preliminary examination in the 16CF-253 file.
The other files have been set for a plea hearing in August.

Atty Knaapen suggests all the files be calendared for a status about three months out.

Court will set the matters for a pretrial. 
Court addresses the parties with regards to the medication issue.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court with regards to the medication issue.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court  with regards to the medication issue.
Atty Knaapen replies.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not order involuntary medication. Defendant has not refused medication.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, refers to report as reference to medication.

Court finds that the order to treat is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds that Defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time but more likely than not to become competent within time frame permissible if provided with treatment including medications at appropriate facility. Court will order the administrative of medications and suspend proceedings.  Commitment will become effective immediately.  

State believes that Defendant has been in custody since June 8th. 

BY THE COURT:
Department will designate receiving institution and Defendant will be transported to that institution. Order can be generated and Court will sign the order once completed. 

Atty Drengler addresses the Court regarding possible delays and moving Defendant up the list.  Court would entertain that matter if it becomes necessary. 

Court will generate the order and circulate it.

10:21 AM Court is in recess.  Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on July 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
/s/RJS Plea/sentencing hrg set. Original filed in 15CT-179.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Record Update - original filed in 16CF123
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Ryan Drengler appointed

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Dorothy Boone or her residence 
  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Kimberly Spreda unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:19 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic, Battery - Domestic and Criminal Trespass to Dwelling.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant currently out on bond.
State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes a statement as to what happened not the bond requirement.
Atty Drengler would like that the defendant no longer make any statements on this case; defendant makes further statements.
Defendant indicates he is receiving SSI benefits and would lose this if jailed with a  cash bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   March 14, 2016 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
